title: â€˜Go learn geographyâ€™: Internet goes wild over presidential candidate Macronâ€™s French Guiana mishap
text:
â€˜Go learn geographyâ€™: Internet goes wild over presidential candidate Macronâ€™s French Guiana mishap Published time: 27 Mar, 2017 16:41 Get short URL French presidential candidate Emmanuel Macron has made a geography gaffe, mistaking the countryâ€™s overseas territory French Guiana for an island, leaving netizens in a tizzy. 
Macron, who is on a tour of Franceâ€™s overseas territories, expressed concern over the escalating tensions caused by a general strike in French Guiana on Monday. 
â€œWhatâ€™s been happening in French Guiana over the past few days is serious. My first response is a call for calm, because blocking the airport runways and takeoffs â€“ and sometimes even blocking off the function of the island itself â€“ is not the response to the situation,â€ Macron said. 
In fact, French Guiana, one of five French overseas territories, isnâ€™t an island at all, but part of the coast of South America and the second largest region of France. 
Journalists didnâ€™t seem to pick up on the mistake at first either, but the gaffe was later lampooned in the French media under headlines such as: â€œMacron and Guiana the â€˜islandâ€™â€ and â€œMacron and his blunderâ€ . Le Parisien even published a quiz so that readers could find out if they knew French geography better than the presidential candidate. 
The Internet went wild, too. 
â€œ[The French] Guiana by Macron,â€ one tweet said, adding some (ir)relevant pictures. â€” ğŸƒ FouFou 2017 ğŸƒ (@20RueduCirque) 26 Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ° 2017 Ğ³. 
"Itâ€™s you Macron, who is a grave [situation]! You want to be the president of our country, and you think that Guiana is an island! Our French [citizens] of Guiana will be pleased,â€ another user wrote in the comments below the YouTube video showing Macron making the mistake. 
â€œHe wants to become president... Go learn some geography first!â€ another user posted on YouTube. 
Another Twitter user posted a photo of Macron supposedly searching for French Guiana on the web with a cover of Jules Verneâ€™s â€˜Mysterious Islandâ€™ posted just next to it. People also recalled previous mistakes made by French government officials. â€œWith Hollande we found Macedonia, with Duflot Japan in the southern hemisphere, with Macron Guiana island,â€ a user tweeted.
